item.title: 日本执政党即将选出新党首，可能进行决选
item.description: 日本执政党自民党准备在周六选举新领导人，这次投票也可能决定谁将成为日本下一任首相。【原文：Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party is poised to elect its new leader on Saturday, in a vote that is also likely to determine who will become Japan’s next prime minister.】

item.title: 花旗银行的 Banamex 获得墨西哥矿业大亨的竞标
item.description: 墨西哥矿业巨头 German Larrea 的 Grupo Mexico SAB 提议购买花旗集团旗下 Banamex 公司的全部控制权，这可能会打乱原计划通过向另一位墨西哥亿万富翁出售股份将该公司转变为上市公司的计划。【原文：Mexican mining magnate German Larrea’s Grupo Mexico SAB offered to buy full control of Citigroup Inc.’s Banamex unit, a potential disruption in what had been a plan to convert the business into a publicly traded company by initially selling a stake to another Mexican billionaire.】

item.title: 法院称解雇波多黎各监督委员会成员不合法
item.description: 美国波多黎各地区法院裁定，特朗普政府在 8 月份解雇波多黎各金融监督机构成员时越权。【原文：The Trump administration overstepped its authority when it fired members of Puerto Rico’s financial watchdog in August, the US District Court of Puerto Rico ruled.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁向阿根廷表示支持，提振阿根廷债券
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）总裁周五发出了支持阿根廷的新声音，支持特朗普政府在本月晚些时候举行的阿根廷中期选举之前为支持哈维尔-米莱总统所做的努力。【原文：The head of the International Monetary Fund offered a fresh voice of support for Argentina Friday, backing Trump administration efforts to shore up President Javier Milei before Argentina’s midterm elections later this month.】

item.title: 人工智能计算、芯片初创企业 Cerebras 撤回 IPO 注册
item.description: Cerebras Systems Inc. 在公开发布首次公开募股计划一年多后，已申请撤回相关文件。【原文：Cerebras Systems Inc. has filed to withdraw paperwork for an initial public offering more than a year after publicly unveiling plans.】

item.title: Coinbase 寻求 OCC 信托许可以发展支付业务
item.description: 美国最大的加密货币交易所 Coinbase Global Inc.周五表示，该公司正在向美国货币监理署（Office of Comptroller of the Currency）申请国家信托公司特许。【原文：Coinbase Global Inc., the largest US crypto exchange, is seeking a national trust company charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the company said Friday.】

item.title: Xbox 的游戏通行证涨价显示了《使命召唤》销量损失的代价
item.description: 本周，微软公司的 Xbox 部门宣布将其 Game Pass 订阅服务的最高级别价格上涨 50%，达到每月 30 美元，这让许多视频游戏爱好者大吃一惊。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s Xbox division surprised many video game enthusiasts this week when the company announced a 50% price hike, to $30 a month, for the highest level tier in its Game Pass subscription service.】

item.title: 特朗普征收 10 万美元 H-1B 费用引来商业团体罕见抨击
item.description: 一个商业团体联盟警告唐纳德-特朗普总统，新宣布的对 H-1B 签证申请征收 10 万美元费用有可能损害美国经济，并敦促美国政府避免对技术工人计划进行修改，以免增加公司负担。【原文：A coalition of business groups warned President Donald Trump that a newly announced $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications risks harming the US economy and urged the administration to avoid changes to the skilled worker program that impose added burdens on companies.】

item.title: 贝莱德斥资 400 亿美元押注鲜为人知的数据中心公司
item.description: 今年年初，一家名不见经传的基础设施公司 Aligned Data Centers 成功募集到了 120 亿美元的资金。该公司的目标是：大幅扩大业务范围，以支持人工智能系统对设施的激增需求。【原文：At the start of the year, a lesser-known infrastructure company called Aligned Data Centers managed to pull off a $12 billion fundraise — more than some of the world’s leading artificial intelligence startups have been able to secure in a single round. The goal: dramatically expanding its footprint to support surging demand for the facilities that power AI systems.】

item.title: 华尔街动量交易员迎来三年来最佳表现
item.description: 九月份，很多事情都变得更糟了。政府关门，美国就业前景暗淡，围绕央行自主权的争论愈演愈烈。【原文：A lot of things got worse in September. The government shut down, US job prospects dimmed, and debates around central bank autonomy grew deafening.】

item.title: 哈马斯同意特朗普结束战争的部分条件，谢克尔跳水
item.description: 哈马斯表示同意释放所有以色列人质，并接受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关于在周日晚间最后期限前结束加沙战争的计划的其他部分后，以色列谢克尔跳涨至盘中高点。【原文：Israel’s shekel jumped to a session high after Hamas said it’s agreed to release all Israeli hostages and accepted other parts of US President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza ahead of the Sunday evening deadline.】

item.title: 谷歌认为强制出售广告交易平台风险太大
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司过去一周一直在弗吉尼亚州联邦法院试图说服法官，出售其广告交易平台风险太大、技术难度太高，而且会扰乱市场。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google has spent the past week in Virginia federal court seeking to persuade a judge that selling off its advertising exchange is too risky, technologically difficult and would disrupt the market.】

item.title: 三色受托人称初步调查显示 "普遍 "存在欺诈行为
item.description: 一名律师周五在法庭上表示，监管破产的 Tricolor Holdings 的受托人正在调查这家次级汽车贷款公司在倒闭前可能存在的不当行为，以便筹集资金偿还债权人。【原文：The trustee overseeing bankrupt Tricolor Holdings is investigating possible wrongdoing by the subprime auto lender before its collapse in order to raise money to pay creditors, a lawyer said in court Friday.】

item.title: 财政部考虑在新一美元硬币上印上特朗普头像
item.description: 据官员透露，美国财政部正在考虑铸造一枚印有唐纳德-特朗普总统头像的 1 美元硬币，以纪念美国建国 250 周年。【原文：The US Treasury is considering minting a $1 coin featuring President Donald Trump’s visage to commemorate the nation’s 250th birthday, according to officials.】

item.title: 稳定币领导者 Tether 为代币化黄金储备寻求资本
item.description: Tether Holdings SA和一家与比特币硬件巨头比特大陆科技有限公司（Bitmain Technologies Ltd.）关系密切的公司正在洽谈为一个积累代币化黄金的公共工具筹集资金。【原文：Tether Holdings SA and a company with close ties to Bitmain Technologies Ltd., the Bitcoin hardware giant, are in talks to raise capital for a public vehicle that would accumulate tokenized gold.】

item.title: 三色记录显示同一辆汽车涉及数千笔贷款
item.description: 对破产的次级汽车贷款公司 Tricolor Holdings 的记录进行的初步审查显示，至少有 2.9 万笔抵押给债权人的贷款与已为其他债务提供担保的车辆挂钩。【原文：An initial review of bankrupt subprime auto lender Tricolor Holdings’ records shows that at least 29,000 loans pledged to creditors were tied to vehicles already securing other debts.】

item.title: 布拉斯凯姆公司在债务审查中撤出 10 亿美元信用贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，巴西化工巨头 Braskem SA 公司在行业不景气和投资者日益担忧的情况下，动用了全部 10 亿美元的信贷额度。【原文：Braskem SA, the Brazilian chemical giant, tapped the entirety of a $1 billion credit line amid an industry downturn and mounting investor concern, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 花旗建议交易通货紧缩，美联储 2026-2027 年加息
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）的策略师表示，美联储降息很可能导致明年经济反弹，从而刺激投资者押注在 2027 年底之前加息。【原文：Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts are likely to lead to an economic rebound next year that spurs investors to bet on rate increases by late-2027, Citigroup Inc. strategists say.】

item.title: 美联储洛根发出信号：通胀是首要问题，敦促谨慎加息
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）表示，美国央行距离通胀目标比距离最大就业目标更远，并重申官员们应谨慎对待降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank is further away from its inflation target than it is from the maximum employment goal, and reiterated that officials should move cautiously with interest-rate reductions.】

item.title: 3M 考虑数十亿美元分割工业业务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，3M 公司正在考虑出售其工业业务中数十亿美元的资产，因为该公司希望分拆低增长的业务。【原文：3M Co. is considering selling billions of dollars of assets from its industrials operations as it looks to carve out low-growth businesses, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: EA 私有化交易对投资者有利，对员工不利
item.description: 杠杆收购几乎总是以大幅裁员的形式削减成本【原文：Leveraged buyouts almost always lead to cost-cutting in the form of big layoffs】

item.title: Palantir 在股价下跌后反驳安全漏洞说法
item.description: 帕兰提尔科技公司（Palantir Technologies Inc.）的股价周五下跌超过 8%，此前有报道称该公司的战场通信系统与国防科技公司安杜里尔工业公司（Anduril Industries Inc.【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc.’s stock fell more than 8% on Friday following a report that its battlefield communications system, along with that of defense tech firm Anduril Industries Inc., was seriously flawed — a claim both companies said was out of date and inaccurate.】

item.title: 马克龙指责俄罗斯造成一名法国记者在乌克兰死亡
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统周五将法国摄影记者安东尼-拉利坎（Antoni Lallican）在乌克兰执行任务时死于无人机袭击一事归咎于俄罗斯。【原文：President Emmanuel Macron blamed Russia for the death on Friday of a French photojournalist, Antoni Lallican, in a drone attack while on assignment in Ukraine.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊再次警告通胀和就业目标面临的风险
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周五重申了他的担忧，即在通胀保持在目标之上的同时，央行还在兼顾劳动力市场疲软的问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson on Friday repeated his concerns that the central bank is juggling both a softening labor market at the same time that inflation remains above target.】

item.title: 德克萨斯证券交易所交易预计将于第一季度开始
item.description: 据新市场的一位重要顾问称，德克萨斯证券交易所有望在第一季度开始交易。【原文：The Texas Stock Exchange is expected to begin trading during the first quarter, according to a key adviser to the new marketplace.】

item.title: 空头支票公司 MAK 在加拿大申请 1 亿美元 IPO
item.description: MAK Acquisition Corp.是一家由前 Dye & Durham Ltd.高管领导的空白支票公司，申请首次公开募股 1 亿美元，寻求利用投资者对技术和国防相关交易的兴趣。【原文：MAK Acquisition Corp., a blank-check company led by former Dye & Durham Ltd. executives, filed for a $100 million initial public offering, seeking to capitalize on investor interest in technology and defense-related deals.】

item.title: 显示市场狂躁程度的股票
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 摩根士丹利称国债期权将面临 10 至 29 天的关闭
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的利率策略师表示，国债期权定价表明，10 月 1 日开始的美国政府关门将至少持续 10 天，最长可达 29 天。【原文：Treasury options pricing suggests that the US government shutdown that began Oct. 1 will last at least 10 and as many as 29 days, according to interest-rate strategists at Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: 美国政府监管机构将评估私人信贷风险
item.description: 美国政府问责局正在评估私人信贷带来的风险，这表明华盛顿正在进一步审查这个价值 1.7 万亿美元的行业对更广泛经济的影响。【原文：The US Government Accountability Office is assessing the risks posed by private credit, in a sign that Washington is further scrutinizing the impact of the $1.7 trillion industry on the broader economy.】
